meanings.definition: Change or alter in form, appearance, or nature.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar will transubstantiate into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the tadpole will transubstantiate into a frog.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my old toys will transubstantiate into something new and exciting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to transubstantiate the gloomy room into a bright and cheerful space.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand was said to transubstantiate ordinary objects into gold.

meanings.definition: Transform into another substance, especially in a religious context.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest will transubstantiate the bread into the body of Christ.
meanings.sent2: According to the belief, water can transubstantiate into holy water through a blessing.
meanings.sent3: The potion was rumored to transubstantiate the drinker into a powerful wizard.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to transubstantiate the atmosphere, filling it with peace and serenity.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual was said to transubstantiate the ordinary stones into precious gems.
